Detailed Description

Conversion between UTF-8 and UTF-16 strings.

UTF-8 is used by web pages. It is a variable byte length encoding of UNICODE characters which is independant of the byte order in a computer word.

UTF-16 is the native Windows UNICODE encoding.

The class stores two copies of the string, one in each encoding, so should only exist briefly while conversion is done.

This is a wrapper for the WideCharToMultiByte and MultiByteToWideChar
